critique: This executive order pertains to the closure of government offices in the District of Columbia on two specific Saturdays (December 24 and December 31, 1932) and excuses federal employees from duty on those days, with exceptions for special public reasons or inconsistencies with existing law. It does not touch upon ideological matters, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, all axes should be scored as neutral.
